Articles.Content: That\'s why I hate that time stuff. That\'s probably too late...

Stream\'s just started; http://www.ulalaunch.com/site/pages/Webcast.shtml

Hopefully they checked all the valves this time.

EDIT: About 15 minutes till launch is planned.
and today the countdown page works: http://countdown.ksc.nasa.gov/elv
the polling is go... we will get a launch today

T 1 minutes before lift-off.

Lift-off!!!

SRB-Burn out.

SRB-Separation

Fairing Separation

BECO.

Stage 2 separation

MECO-1

Centaur second burn.

MECO-2

Spacecraft separation.

Playing KSP, then watching a live rocket launch?

Priceless.
btw... the next launch is a soyuz launch with 3 new crewmembers for the iss... on may 15th 0301utc...

http://www.spaceflightnow.com/station/exp31/rollout/

rollout photos for the next launch - soyuz fg with the new crew for the iss... the launch is tomorrow

Uh, it just shows those coular bars and says spaceflightnow.

nothing is happening ???
The launch tower is a train wagon?

The launch tower is a train wagon?

no, just the raising mechanism is a train wagon - it will be moved away...

you can see the actual launch tower on the second to last photo - it is the green thing, for now in a lower position

it looks like this, with the tower in the position: http://www.technovelgy.com/graphics/content05/soyuz.jpg
Ah thanks, now I see it too.

Coverage for manned Soyuz launch starts in about half an hour here.

EDIT: Stream has started.

Double EDIT: I\'m not too sure why it\'s started, launch isn\'t due for another three hours...
2 hours...
Interesting ill watch
should be launching now
the launch has been successful...

btw:

if anyone is interested, we have actually a very busy week: the next launches are:

today (15):

- european ariane v with two commercial comm sats, the launch window starts at 2201utc

may of 17:

- japanese h-2a with 2 earth observation sats (1639utc)

- russian proton with a comm sat for canada (1912utc)

- russian soyuz with a recon sat for russian govt (time not known)

may 19:

- spacex falcon 9 with a dragon spacecraft - c2+ mission (0855utc)

ariane v launch in 2 hrs...

live stream will be on http://www.arianespace.tv/

Stream is up.

Launch in 10 minutes
2 minutes.
and lift-off...
and the launch is successful... both sats separated and on their ways...

Lies! :U

Europe is too lazy to get off it\'s ass and even look at spess.
soyuz has successfully docked to the station
